detail: As a non-Muslim, I cannot see anything "sinful" about financial institutions charging interest for loans. To me (and probably, billions of others), it makes perfect sense - there is always going to be some risk involved if Person A lends $x to Person B, so charging interest for $x is logical. However, I understand that Islamic finance has its own ways around charging interest to ensure the profitability and sustainability of Islamic banks.That being said, what exactly is wrong about charging interest in the first place? Why is it considered a major sin in Islam?
title: Why is charging interest (usury) forbidden in Islam?
